contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist <!-- For individuals; see Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Emma Härdelin | image = | alt = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1975|09|26}} | origin = [[Sweden]] | instrument = | genre = [[Folk music|Folk]], [[Folk-rock]] | occupation = [[Singer]] | years_active = 1993–present | label = | associated_acts = [[Garmarna]], [[Triakel]] | website = | notable_instruments = }} '''Emma Härdelin''' (born September 26, 1975) is a [[Sweden|Swedish]] musician. She is a [[violin]]ist and lead [[singer]] in [[folk-rock]] band [[Garmarna]], which she joined in 1993 for their first album, and also lead singer for the [[folk music|folk]] band [[Triakel]]. Härdelin was born into a family of nationally acclaimed musicians as the daughter of Swedish traditional fiddler [[Thore Härdelin]]. She grew up in [[Kluk]], [[Jämtland]], and [[Delsbo]], [[Hälsingland]]. After attending a [[Waldorf School|Waldorf]] school and studying Swedish folk singing under [[Maria Röjås]] at [[Malung]] [[folkhögskola]], she became a member of [[Garmarna]] in 1993, and founded [[Triakel]] in 1995 together with [[Kjell-Erik Eriksson]] of [[Hoven Droven]] and [[Janne Strömstedt]]. In 2004, she appeared on [[Blindside (band)|Blindside]]'s album ''[[About a Burning Fire]]'', on the song ''Shekina''. 2005 saw the release of ''[[Kärleksbrev och ryska satelliter]]'', a folk album by Härdelin, [[Kersti Ståbi]], [[Johanna Bölja Hertzberg]] and [[Katarina Hallberg]]. She also performs on a recording of Swedish music from [[Estonia]] entitled ''Strand...Rand''. In 2007, Emma released an album with [[String Sisters]], a sextet featuring other fiddlers including [[Altan (band)|Altan]]'s [[Mairéad Ní Mhaonaigh]]. == External links == * [http://www.jamtlandica.com/mp3/Kaukning_EH.mp3 Listen to "kaukning"] Emma Härdelin is singing a cattle call in a music genre called [[kaukning]], [http://www.jamtlandica.com/jamtland/ Folk Music in Jamtland, Sweden] * [http://www.jamtlandica.com/mp3/ifjoljettjegjeittom.mp3 Listen to Emma singing "I fjol gjett je gjeita" ] Last year I was herding the goats in the valley, [http://www.jamtlandica.com/jamtland/ Folk Music in Jamtland, Sweden] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hardelin, Emma | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = September 26, 1975 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hardelin, Emma}} [[Category:1975 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Swedish folk singers]] [[Category:Swedish fiddlers]] [[Category:Nordic folk musicians]] [[Category:Waldorf school alumni]] [[Category:Fiddlers from Sweden]]
